intro: Crotalaria cobalticola, commonly known as the cobalt blue crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry to semi-arid conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
